oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A survey of abomasal ulceration in veal calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Welchman, D. de B.
Baust, G. N.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Abomasal ulceration
veal calves
lesions
milk substitute
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Abomasal ulceration was found in 264 of 304 commercially reared veal calves at slaughter. The incidence and severity of lesions were greatest in loose housed calves with access to straw and fed milk substitute ad libitum. Full article published in Veterinary Record (1987) 121, 586-590
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1987; 167
